TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable beforefieldinit CultureInfo extends System.Object implements class System.ICloneable, class System.IFormatProvider
Public Class CultureInfo Implements ICloneable, IFormatProvider
public ref class CultureInfo : ICloneable, IFormatProvider
type CultureInfo = class interface ICloneable interface IFormatProvider

summary.span: 提供有關特定文化特性 (Culture) 的資訊 (文化特性在 Unmanaged 程式碼開發中稱為「地區設定」)。

span.span: Provides information about a specific culture (called a *locale* for unmanaged code development).

summary.span: 這項資訊包含文化特性的名稱、書寫系統、使用的曆法、字串的排序次序，以及日期和數字的格式。

span.span: The information includes the names for the culture, the writing system, the calendar used, the sort order of strings, and formatting for dates and numbers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別提供特定文化特性資訊，例如語言、 次語言、 國家/地區、 行事曆和特定文化特性相關聯的慣例。The class provides culture-specific information, such as the language, sublanguage, country/region, calendar, and conventions associated with a particular culture. 這個類別也會提供存取的特定文化特性的執行個體， ， ，和物件。This class also provides access to culture-specific instances of the , , , and objects. 這些物件包含特定文化特性的作業，例如大小寫、 格式化日期和數字和比較字串所需的資訊。These objects contain the information required for culture-specific operations, such as casing, formatting dates and numbers, and comparing strings. 類別可供直接或間接類別，可格式化、 剖析，或處理特定文化特性的資料，例如， ， ，和數字的類型。The class is used either directly or indirectly by classes that format, parse, or manipulate culture-specific data, such as , , , and the numeric types. 本節內容：In this section: [文化特性名稱和識別碼](#CultureNames) [Culture names and identifiers](#CultureNames) [非變異、 中性和特定文化特性](#Invariant) [Invariant, neutral, and specific cultures](#Invariant) [自訂文化特性](#Custom) [Custom cultures](#Custom) [動態的文化特性的資料](#Dynamic) [Dynamic culture data](#Dynamic) [CultureInfo 和文化特性的資料](#cultureinfo-and-cultural-data)[目前 UI 文化特性與目前的文化特性](#Current) [CultureInfo and cultural data](#cultureinfo-and-cultural-data) [The current culture and current UI culture](#Current) [取得所有文化特性](#GetAll) [Getting all cultures](#GetAll) [文化特性和執行緒](#Threads) [Culture and threads](#Threads) [文化特性和應用程式網域](#AppDomain) [Culture and application domains](#AppDomain) [文化特性和以工作為基礎的非同步作業](#Async) [Culture and task-based asynchronous operations](#Async) [CultureInfo 物件的序列化](#Serialization) [CultureInfo object serialization](#Serialization) [控制台會覆寫](#CPanel) [Control Panel overrides](#CPanel) [替代排序次序](#AlternateSort) [Alternate sort orders](#AlternateSort) [文化特性和 Windows 應用程式Culture and Windows apps](#Windows) ## 文化特性名稱和識別碼Culture names and identifiers 類別會指定每個文化特性，根據 RFC 4646 的唯一名稱。The class specifies a unique name for each culture, based on RFC 4646. 名稱是與語言相關聯的 ISO 639 兩個字母小寫文化特性代碼和國家/地區或區域相關聯的 ISO 3166 兩個字母大寫子文化特性代碼的組合。The name is a combination of an ISO 639 two-letter lowercase culture code associated with a language and an ISO 3166 two-letter uppercase subculture code associated with a country or region. 此外，針對目標應用程式[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]或更新版本，而且正在執行 Windows 10 或更新版本中，對應至有效 BCP-47 語言標記支援的文化特性名稱。In addition, for apps that target [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] or later and are running under Windows 10 or later, culture names that correspond to valid BCP-47 language tags are supported. > [!NOTE] > 當文化特性名稱傳遞至類別建構函式或方法這類或，其大小寫不重要。When a culture name is passed to a class constructor or a method such as or , its case is not significant. 格式為文化特性名稱，根據 RFC 4646 *languagecode2*>-*country/regioncode2*，其中*languagecode2*是兩個字母的語言代碼並*country/regioncode2*是兩個字母子文化特性的程式碼。The format for the culture name based on RFC 4646 is *languagecode2*>-*country/regioncode2*, where *languagecode2* is the two-letter language code and *country/regioncode2* is the two-letter subculture code. 範例包括 JA-JP 日文 （日本） 和 EN-US，適用於英文 （美國）。Examples include ja-JP for Japanese (Japan) and en-US for English (United States). 在兩個字母的語言程式碼不提供的情況下，會使用衍生自 ISO 639-2 三個字母代碼。In cases where a two-letter language code is not available, a three-letter code derived from ISO 639-2 is used. 請注意，某些文化特性名稱也會指定 ISO 15924。Note that some culture names also specify an ISO 15924 script. 比方說，Cyrl 指定斯拉夫文的指令碼和 Latn 指定英文的指令碼。For example, Cyrl specifies the Cyrillic script and Latn specifies the Latin script. 文化特性名稱，其中包含指令碼會使用模式*languagecode2*-*scripttag*-*country/regioncode2*。A culture name that includes a script uses the pattern *languagecode2*-*scripttag*-*country/regioncode2*. 這種文化特性名稱的範例是 uz 代表烏茲別克文 （斯拉夫，烏茲別克）。An example of this type of culture name is uz-Cyrl-UZ for Uzbek (Cyrillic, Uzbekistan). 在 Windows 作業系統在 Windows Vista 之前，文化特性名稱，其中包含指令碼會使用模式*languagecode2*-*country/regioncode2* - *scripttag*，比方說，uz-UZ-Cyrl 烏茲別克文 （斯拉夫，烏茲別克）。On Windows operating systems before Windows Vista, a culture name that includes a script uses the pattern *languagecode2*-*country/regioncode2*-*scripttag*, for example, uz-UZ-Cyrl for Uzbek (Cyrillic, Uzbekistan). 中性文化特性是由兩個字母小寫字母的語言程式碼指定。A neutral culture is specified by only the two-letter lowercase language code. 比方說，fr 指定中性文化特性的法文和德國德文指定中性文化特性。For example, fr specifies the neutral culture for French, and de specifies the neutral culture for German. > [!NOTE] > 有兩個相互抵觸此規則的文化特性名稱。There are two culture names that contradict this rule. 中文 （簡體）、 名為 Zh-hans 和中文 （繁體）、 名為 Zh-hant，文化特性是中性文化特性。The cultures Chinese (Simplified), named zh-Hans, and Chinese (Traditional), named zh-Hant, are neutral cultures. 文化特性名稱代表目前的標準，而應使用，除非您有使用的舊名稱 ZH-CHS 和 ZH-CHT 的原因。The culture names represent the current standard and should be used unless you have a reason for using the older names zh-CHS and zh-CHT. 文化特性識別項是標準的國際數字縮寫，來唯一識別其中已安裝的文化特性所需的元件。A culture identifier is a standard international numeric abbreviation and has the components necessary to uniquely identify one of the installed cultures. 您的應用程式可以使用預先定義的文化特性識別項，或定義自訂的識別項。Your application can use predefined culture identifiers or define custom identifiers. 某些預先定義的文化特性名稱，這和中的其他類別所使用的識別項命名空間。Certain predefined culture names and identifiers are used by this and other classes in the namespace. 詳細的文化特性資訊會出現在[國家語言支援 (NLS) API 參考](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在 Go Global Developer Center。Detailed culture information appears in the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 請記住的文化特性名稱和識別碼，代表只可以在特定電腦找到的文化特性的子集。Remember that the culture names and identifiers represent only a subset of cultures that can be found on a particular computer. Windows 版本或 service pack 可以變更可用的文化特性。Windows versions or service packs can change the available cultures. 應用程式將使用的自訂文化特性類別。Applications add custom cultures using the class. 使用者會新增自己自訂的文化特性，使用 Microsoft Locale Builder 工具。Users add their own custom cultures using the Microsoft Locale Builder tool. Microsoft Locale Builder 以 managed 程式碼使用`CultureAndRegionInfoBuilder`類別。Microsoft Locale Builder is written in managed code using the `CultureAndRegionInfoBuilder` class. 數個不同的名稱是密切相關聯的文化特性，值得注意的是將下列類別成員相關聯的名稱：Several distinct names are closely associated with a culture, notably the names associated with the following class members: - - - ## 非變異、 中性和特定文化特性Invariant, neutral, and specific cultures 文化特性通常分為三個集合： 而異的文化特性、 中性文化特性和特定文化特性。The cultures are generally grouped into three sets: invariant cultures, neutral cultures, and specific cultures. 不區分文化特性的文化特性而異。An invariant culture is culture-insensitive. 您的應用程式指定文化特性而異，依名稱使用空字串 ("") 或依其識別項。Your application specifies the invariant culture by name using an empty string ("") or by its identifier. 定義文化特性而異的執行個體。 defines an instance of the invariant culture. 相關聯的英文語言使用，但不是能搭配任何國家/地區。It is associated with the English language but not with any country/region. 在幾乎任何方法中使用`Globalization`需要文化特性的命名空間。It is used in almost any method in the `Globalization` namespace that requires a culture. 中性文化特性是相關聯的文化特性使用的語言，但是不會與國家/地區。A neutral culture is a culture that is associated with a language but not with a country/region. 特定文化特性是一種語言和國家/地區相關聯的文化特性。A specific culture is a culture that is associated with a language and a country/region. 比方說，fr 是法文的文化特性的中性名稱，並為 FR-FR 是特定的法文 （法國） 文化特性的名稱。For example, fr is the neutral name for the French culture, and fr-FR is the name of the specific French (France) culture. 請注意，中文 （簡體） 和中文 （繁體） 也會被視為中性文化特性。Note that Chinese (Simplified) and Chinese (Traditional) are also considered neutral cultures. 建立的執行個體中性文化特性不建議，因為它所包含的資料是任意的類別。Creating an instance of a class for a neutral culture is not recommended because the data it contains is arbitrary. 若要顯示和排序資料，請指定語言和區域。To display and sort data, specify both the language and region. 此外，屬性中性文化特性，傳回的國家/地區並不包括地區所建立的物件。Additionally, the property of a object created for a neutral culture returns only the country and does not include the region. 定義的文化特性具有的階層，其中的父代特定文化特性是中性文化特性，而是中性文化特性的父代是文化特性而異。The defined cultures have a hierarchy in which the parent of a specific culture is a neutral culture and the parent of a neutral culture is the invariant culture. 屬性包含特定文化特性相關聯的中性文化特性。The property contains the neutral culture associated with a specific culture. 應該要定義自訂的文化特性符合此模式中的屬性。Custom cultures should define the property in conformance with this pattern. 如果特定文化特性的資源不會在作業系統中可用的則會使用相關聯的中性文化特性的資源。If the resources for a specific culture are not available in the operating system, the resources for the associated neutral culture are used. 如果無法使用中性文化特性的資源時，會使用內嵌於主要組件中的資源。If the resources for the neutral culture are not available, the resources embedded in the main assembly are used. 如需有關資源後援處理序的詳細資訊，請參閱 < [ 封裝和部署資源](~/docs/framework/resources/packaging-and-deploying-resources-in-desktop-apps.md)。For more information on the resource fallback process, see [Packaging and Deploying Resources](~/docs/framework/resources/packaging-and-deploying-resources-in-desktop-apps.md). Windows API 中的地區設定的清單是稍微不同的.NET Framework 所支援的文化特性的清單。The list of locales in the Windows API is slightly different from the list of cultures supported by the .NET Framework. 如果需要與 Windows 的互通性，比方說，透過 p/invoke 機制中，應用程式應該使用特定文化特性所定義的作業系統。If interoperability with Windows is required, for example, through the p/invoke mechanism, the application should use a specific culture that is defined for the operating system. 使用特定文化特性可確保對等的 Windows 地區設定，這識別與相同的地區設定識別碼的一致性。Use of the specific culture ensures consistency with the equivalent Windows locale, which is identified with a locale identifier that is the same as . A或可以建立只而異的文化特性或特定文化特性，而非中性文化特性。A or a can be created only for the invariant culture or for specific cultures, not for neutral cultures. 如果已但不設定為 ZH-TW，然後， ，和傳回空字串 ("")。If is the but the is not set to zh-TW, then , , and return an empty string (""). ## 自訂文化特性Custom cultures 除了預先定義的文化特性支援的 Windows 作業系統和.NET Framework 時，.NET Framework 支援三種類型的自訂文化特性：In addition to the predefined cultures supported by the Windows operating system and the .NET Framework, the .NET Framework supports three types of custom cultures: - 補充的文化特性可在 Windows 或.NET Framework 中的新文化特性。New cultures that supplement the cultures available in Windows or the .NET Framework. 例如，應用程式無法安裝代表 fj-fj 將 （或 Fijan （斐濟）） 文化特性的系統上的物件。For example, an application could install a object that represents the fj-FJ (or Fijan (Fiji)) culture on a system. - 其屬性會不同於標準 Windows 和.NET Framework 所支援的文化特性的屬性取代的文化特性。Replacement cultures whose properties are different from the properties of the standard cultures supported by Windows and the .NET Framework. - 標準使用者的文化特性會覆寫。Standard cultures with user overrides. 使用者可以使用**地區和語言**應用程式**控制台**自訂現有文化特性的屬性值。The user can use the **Region and Language** application in **Control Panel** to customize an existing culture's property values. > [!NOTE] > 您可以使用類別來定義、 儲存及註冊自訂的文化特性，來補充或取代現有的文化特性。You can use the class to define, save, and register custom cultures that either supplement or replace existing cultures. 方法會建立可用來在目標系統上安裝自訂的文化特性的地區設定資料標記語言 (LDML) 檔案。The method creates a Locale Data Markup Language (LDML) file that can be used to install a custom culture on target systems. 如逐步步驟需使用來建立新的類別或取代的文化特性，請參閱類別主題。For step-by step information on using the class to create a new or replacement culture, see the class topic. 由於.NET Framework 支援自訂文化特性，您應該考慮下列使用特定文化特性的資料時：Because the .NET Framework supports custom cultures, you should consider the following when working with culture-specific data: - 自訂文化特性可以有超過預先定義的文化特性的範圍的值。Custom cultures can have values that exceed the ranges of the predefined cultures. 比方說，某些文化特性已久的月份名稱、 未預期的日期或時間格式或其他不尋常的資料。For example, some cultures have unusually long month names, unexpected date or time formats, or other unusual data. - 當您在使用者介面中顯示特定文化特性的資料時，您應該採用使用者的自訂項目;例如，使用者可能會想採用 24 小時制或 yyyyMMdd 日期格式。When you display culture-specific data in the user interface, you should respect the user's customizations; for example, the user might want a 24-hour clock or a yyyyMMdd date format. - 請記住，自訂文化特性覆寫預設值。Remember that custom cultures override default values. 因此，您無法考慮文化特性資料視為穩定。Therefore, you cannot consider culture data to be stable. 國家/地區名稱、 數字和日期格式和拼字可能在未來變更。Country names, number and date formats, and spellings may change in the future. 如果您想要將區分文化特性的資料，例如要傳遞至日期和時間剖析函式的日期和時間字串序列化，您應該使用區分文化特性或特定。If you want to serialize culture-sensitive data such as date and time strings to be passed to the date and time parsing functions, you should use the invariant culture or a specific . 安裝在系統上的自訂文化特性的屬性值會包含旗標及自訂的文化特性會被指派屬性值為`LOCALE_CUSTOM_UNSPECIFIED`（0x1000 控制或 4096）。The property value of custom cultures installed on a system includes the flag, and custom cultures are assigned an property value of `LOCALE_CUSTOM_UNSPECIFIED` (0x1000, or 4096). 請注意，從 Windows 10 開始，這個值也會指派給系統定義的文化特性缺少完整文化特性的資料。Note that, starting with Windows 10, this value is also assigned to system-defined cultures that lack complete cultural data. ## CultureInfo 和文化特性的資料CultureInfo and cultural data .NET 衍生其文化特性的資料從各種來源，取決於實作、 平台和版本的其中一個：.NET derives its cultural data from a one of a variety of sources, depending on implementation, platform, and version: - 在.NET Framework 3.5 和更早版本中，文化特性的資料是由 Windows 作業系統和.NET Framework 提供。In .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions, cultural data is provided by both the Windows operating system and the .NET Framework. - 在.NET Framework 4 和更新版本中，由 Windows 作業系統提供文化特性的資料。In .NET Framework 4 and later versions, cultural data is provided by the Windows operating system. - 在所有版本的 Windows 上執行的.NET Core，文化特性的資料是由 Windows 作業系統提供。In all versions of .NET Core running on Windows, cultural data is provided by the Windows operating system. - 在所有版本的 Unix 平台上執行的.NET Core，文化特性的資料會提供[Unicode (ICU) 程式庫的多語系元件](http://site.icu-project.org/)。In all versions of .NET Core running on Unix platforms, cultural data is provided by the [International Components for Unicode (ICU) Library](http://site.icu-project.org/). ICU 程式庫的特定版本取決於個別的作業系統。The specific version of the ICU Library depends on the individual operating system. 因為這個緣故，在特定.NET 實作、 平台或版本，您可以使用的文化特性可能無法在不同.NET 實作、 平台或版本。Because of this, a culture available on a particular .NET implementation, platform, or version may not be available on a different .NET implementation, platform, or version. 某些`CultureInfo`物件基礎的平台而有所不同。Some `CultureInfo` objects differ depending on the underlying platform. 特別是，「 ZH-CN 」 或中文 （簡體，中國） 和 ZH-TW、 中文 （繁體，台灣），會在 Windows 系統上可用的文化特性，但會在 Unix 系統上的別名文化特性。In particular, "zh-CN", or Chinese (Simplified, China) and zh-TW, or Chinese (Traditional, Taiwan), are available cultures on Windows systems, but they are aliased cultures on Unix systems. 「 ZH-CN 」 是 「 Hans-ZH-CN"文化特性的別名和"ZH-TW"是"Hant-ZH-TW"文化特性的別名。"zh-CN" is an alias for the "zh-Hans-CN" culture, and "zh-TW" is an alias for the "zh-Hant-TW" culture. 別名的文化特性不會傳回呼叫方法，可能有不同的屬性值，包括不同文化特性，比與其 Windows 對應項目。Aliased cultures are not returned by calls to the method and may have different property values, including different cultures, than their Windows counterparts. 這些 differenes ZH-CN 和 ZH-TW 文化特性，包括下列：For the zh-CN and zh-TW cultures, these differenes include the following: - Windows 系統上 「 ZH-CN 」 文化特性的父文化特性 」 Zh-hans"，而"ZH-TW"文化特性的父文化特性 」 Zh-hant"。On Windows systems, the parent culture of the "zh-CN" culture is "zh-Hans", and the parent culture of the "zh-TW" culture is "zh-Hant". 這些文化特性的父文化特性是 「 zh"。The parent culture of both these cultures is "zh". 在 Unix 系統上兩個文化特性的父代會是"zh 」。On Unix systems, the parents of both cultures are "zh". 這表示，如果您未提供特定文化特性資源之 「 ZH-CN"或"ZH-TW"文化特性，但不要提供資源的中性 」-Zh-hans 」 或 「 Zh-hant"文化特性，您的應用程式會載入在 Windows 上，但不是能在 Unix 中性文化特性的資源.This means that, if you don't provide culture-specific resources for the "zh-CN" or "zh-TW" cultures but do provide a resources for the neutral "zh-Hans" or "zh-Hant" culture, your application will load the resources for the neutral culture on Windows but not on Unix. Unix 系統上，您必須明確設定執行緒的"Zh-hans 」 或 「 Zh-hant"。On Unix systems, you must explicitly set the thread's to either "zh-Hans" or "zh-Hant". - 在 Windows 系統上，呼叫表示執行個體上的 「 ZH-CN 」 文化特性，並將其傳遞 「 Hans-ZH-CN"的執行個體傳回`true`。On Windows systems, calling on an instance that represents the "zh-CN" culture and passing it a "zh-Hans-CN" instance returns `true`. 在 Unix 系統上的方法呼叫傳回`false`。On Unix systems, the method call returns `false`. 此行為也適用於呼叫上"ZH-TW"執行個體，並將其傳遞"Hant-Zh-tw"執行個體。This behavior also applies to calling on a "zh-TW" instance and passing it a "zh-Hant-Tw" instance. ## 動態的文化特性的資料Dynamic culture data 除了文化特性而異，文化特性的資料是動態的。Except for the invariant culture, culture data is dynamic. 這是也適用於預先定義的文化特性。This is true even for the predefined cultures. 例如，國家或地區採用新的貨幣、 變更其拼字的文字，或變更其慣用的行事曆和文化特性定義變更來追蹤這。For example, countries or regions adopt new currencies, change their spellings of words, or change their preferred calendar, and culture definitions change to track this. 自訂文化特性可能會有所變更，恕不另行通知，並可能會由自訂取代的文化特性覆寫任何特定的文化特性。Custom cultures are subject to change without notice, and any specific culture might be overridden by a custom replacement culture. 此外下, 面所述，個別使用者可以覆寫文化特性喜好設定。Also, as discussed below, an individual user can override cultural preferences. 應用程式一律應在執行階段取得文化特性的資料。Applications should always obtain culture data at run time. > [!CAUTION] > 儲存資料時，您的應用程式應該使用文化特性而異，一種二進位格式或特定文化特性無關的格式。When saving data, your application should use the invariant culture, a binary format, or a specific culture-independent format. 根據目前文化特性而異，以外特定文化特性相關聯的值已儲存的資料可能會變得無法讀取，或如果該文化特性變更，可能會變更的意義。Data saved according to the current values associated with a particular culture, other than the invariant culture, might become unreadable or might change in meaning if that culture changes. ## 目前 UI 文化特性與目前的文化特性The current culture and current UI culture 在.NET 應用程式中的每個執行緒有目前的文化特性和目前的 UI 文化特性。Every thread in a .NET application has a current culture and a current UI culture. 目前的文化特性會決定格式設定慣例的日期、 時間、 數字和貨幣值、 文字、 大小寫慣例和比較字串的方式的排序次序。The current culture determines the formatting conventions for dates, times, numbers, and currency values, the sort order of text, casing conventions, and the ways in which strings are compared. 目前的 UI 文化特性用來擷取在執行階段的特定文化特性的資源。The current UI culture is used to retrieve culture-specific resources at [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Class.Async#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.class.async/cs/asyncculture2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Class.Async#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.class.async/vb/asyncculture2.vb#2)] 從.NET Framework 版本為目標的應用程式[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]和更新版本，但之前[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，您可以使用和屬性，以確保呼叫執行緒的文化特性會用於非同步工作在執行緒集區執行緒上執行。For apps that target versions of the .NET Framework from the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] and later but prior to the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], you can use the and properties to ensure that the culture of the calling thread is used in asynchronous tasks that execute on thread pool threads. 下列範例等同於上述範例中，不同之處在於它會使用屬性，以確認該執行緒集區執行緒有相同的文化特性，與主要應用程式的執行緒。The following example is identical to the previous example, except that it uses the property to ensure that thread pool threads have the same culture as the main app thread. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Class.Async#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.class.async/cs/asyncculture3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Class.Async#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.class.async/vb/asyncculture3.vb#3)] 和是每個應用程式定義域屬性; 也就是其所建立的預設文化特性的所有執行緒未明確都指派文化特性特定的應用程式定義域中。 and are per-app domain properties; that is, they establish a default culture for all threads not explicitly assigned a culture in a specific application domain. 不過，對於目標的應用程式[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]或更新版本中，會呼叫執行緒的文化特性仍非同步工作的內容的一部分，即使工作跨越應用程式定義域界限。However, for apps that target the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)] or later, the culture of the calling thread remains part of an asynchronous task's context even if the task crosses app domain boundaries. 下列範例示範即使在執行工作的方法可跨越應用程式定義域界限的呼叫執行緒文化特性，仍會以工作為基礎的非同步作業的目前文化特性。The following example shows that the calling thread's culture remains the current culture of a task-based asynchronous operation even if the method that the task is executing crosses application domain boundaries. 它會定義一個類別， `DataRetriever`，具有單一方法， `GetFormattedNumber`，介於 1 到 1,000 格式化為貨幣值，傳回的隨機的雙精確度浮點數。It defines a class, `DataRetriever`, with a single method, `GetFormattedNumber`, that returns a random double-precision floating-point number between 1 and 1,000 formatted as a currency value. 第一項工作會執行，只會具現化`DataRetriever`執行個體並呼叫其`GetFormattedNumber`方法。A first task is run that simply instantiates a `DataRetriever` instance and calls its `GetFormattedNumber` method. 第二個工作會報告其目前的應用程式定義域、 建立新的應用程式定義域、 具現化`DataRetriever`執行個體，在新的應用程式定義域，然後呼叫其`GetFormattedNumber`方法。A second task reports its current application domain, creates a new application domain, instantiates a `DataRetriever` instance in the new application domain, and calls its `GetFormattedNumber` method. 如範例輸出所示，目前的文化特性一直呼叫的執行緒，第一項工作和第二個工作都在相同的主應用程式定義域和第二個應用程式定義域中執行時。As the output from the example shows, the current culture has remained the same in the calling thread, the first task, and the second task both when it was executing in the main application domain and the second application domain. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Class.Async#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.class.async/cs/asyncculture4.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Class.Async#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.class.async/vb/asyncculture4.vb#4)] ## CultureInfo 物件的序列化CultureInfo object serialization 當序列化物件時，實際上儲存只和。When a object is serialized, all that is actually stored is and . 它是只在環境中成功還原序列化所在的具有相同的意義。It is successfully de-serialized only in an environment where that has the same meaning. 下列三個範例顯示為什麼這不一定會這樣：The following three examples show why this is not always the case: - 如果屬性值是，如果在特定版本的 Windows 作業系統中引進該文化特性，不可能將它還原序列化舊版 Windows 上。If the property value is , and if that culture was first introduced in a particular version of the Windows operating system, it is not possible to deserialize it on an earlier version of Windows. 比方說，如果文化特性在 Windows 10 中引進，它無法還原序列化，在 Windows 8 上。For example, if a culture was introduced in Windows 10, it cannot be deserialized on Windows 8. - 如果值是，並在其已還原序列化的電腦沒有安裝此使用者自訂文化特性，不可能將它還原序列化。If the value is , and the computer on which it is de-serialized does not have this user custom culture installed, it is not possible to deserialize it. - 如果值是，並在其已還原序列化的電腦沒有此取代的文化特性，還原序列化至相同的名稱，但不是所有相同的特性。If the value is , and the computer on which it is de-serialized does not have this replacement culture, it de-serializes to the same name, but not all of the same characteristics. 例如，EN-US 是否取代的文化特性上的電腦，但不是能在電腦 B，以及是否物件指的此文化特性會在電腦 A 上序列化並在電腦 B 上還原序列化則沒有任何自訂的文化特性，傳輸。For example, if en-US is a replacement culture on computer A, but not on computer B, and if a object referring to this culture is serialized on computer A and de-serialized on computer B, then none of the custom characteristics of the culture are transmitted. 文化特性還原序列化成功，但具有不同的意義。The culture deserializes successfully, but with a different meaning. ## 控制台會覆寫Control Panel overrides 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分透過相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 比方說，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值以外的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 一般情況下，您的應用程式應該接受這些使用者覆寫。In general, your applications should honor these user overrides. 如果已`true`和指定的文化特性相符的 Windows，目前的文化特性會使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性，和資料庫屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If is `true` and the specified culture matches the current culture of Windows, the uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果所選行事曆不是其中一個，不會定義方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. ## 替代排序次序Alternate sort orders 某些文化特性支援一個以上的排序次序。Some cultures support more than one sort order. 例如：For example: - 西班牙文 （西班牙） 文化特性中有兩個排序順序： 預設的國際排序順序，與傳統的排序順序。The Spanish (Spain) culture has two sort orders: the default international sort order, and the traditional sort order. 當您具現化ES-ES 文化特性名稱，物件會使用國際排序順序。When you instantiate a object with the es-ES culture name, the international sort order is used. 當您具現化es-ES-tradnl 文化特性名稱，物件會使用傳統的排序順序。When you instantiate a object with the es-ES-tradnl culture name, the traditional sort order is used. - ZH-CN （中文 （簡體，中國）） 文化特性支援兩個排序順序： 依照拼音 （預設值） 和依照筆畫。The zh-CN (Chinese (Simplified, PRC)) culture supports two sort orders: by pronunciation (the default) and by stroke count. 當您具現化ZH-CN 文化特性名稱，物件會使用預設排序順序。When you instantiate a object with the zh-CN culture name, the default sort order is used. 當您具現化0x00020804，區域識別項物件的字串會依照筆畫來排序。When you instantiate a object with a local identifier of 0x00020804, strings are sorted by stroke count. 下表列出支援的預設和替代排序次序的替代排序次序和識別項的文化特性。The following table lists the cultures that support alternate sort orders and the identifiers for the default and alternate sort orders. |文化特性名稱Culture name|cultureCulture|預設排序名稱和識別碼Default sort name and identifier|替代的排序名稱和識別碼Alternate sort name and identifier| |------------------|-------------|--------------------------------------|----------------------------------------| |es-ESes-ES|西班牙文 （西班牙）Spanish (Spain)|國際電話號碼：0x00000C0AInternational: 0x00000C0A|傳統：0x0000040ATraditional: 0x0000040A| |zh-TWzh-TW|中文 （台灣）Chinese (Taiwan)|筆劃數：0x00000404Stroke Count: 0x00000404|注音符號：0x00030404Bopomofo: 0x00030404| |zh-CNzh-CN|中文 （中國）Chinese (PRC)|發音：0x00000804Pronunciation: 0x00000804|筆劃數：0x00020804Stroke Count: 0x00020804| |zh-HKzh-HK|中文 （香港特別行政區）Chinese (Hong Kong SAR)|筆劃數：0x00000c04Stroke Count: 0x00000c04|筆劃數：0x00020c04Stroke Count: 0x00020c04| |zh-SGzh-SG|中文 (新加坡)Chinese (Singapore)|發音：0x00001004Pronunciation: 0x00001004|筆劃數：0x00021004Stroke Count: 0x00021004| |zh-MOzh-MO|中文 (澳門特別行政區)Chinese (Macao SAR)|發音：0x00001404Pronunciation: 0x00001404|筆劃數：0x00021404Stroke Count: 0x00021404| |ja-JPja-JP|日文 （日本）Japanese (Japan)|預設：0x00000411Default: 0x00000411|Unicode：0x00010411Unicode: 0x00010411| |ko-KRko-KR|韓文 （韓國）Korean (Korea)|預設：0x00000412Default: 0x00000412|韓文 Xwansung-Unicode:0x00010412Korean Xwansung - Unicode: 0x00010412| |de-DEde-DE|德文 （德國）German (Germany)|字典中：0x00000407Dictionary: 0x00000407|電話簿排序 DIN:0x00010407Phone Book Sort DIN: 0x00010407| |hu-HUhu-HU|匈牙利文 （匈牙利）Hungarian (Hungary)|預設：0x0000040eDefault: 0x0000040e|技術排序：0x0001040eTechnical Sort: 0x0001040e| |ka-GEka-GE|喬治亞文 （喬治亞）Georgian (Georgia)|傳統：0x00000437Traditional: 0x00000437|現代的排序：0x00010437Modern Sort: 0x00010437| ## 目前的文化特性和 UWP 應用程式The current culture and UWP apps 在通用 Windows 平台 (UWP) 應用程式中，和屬性是讀寫，就如同它們在.NET Framework 和.NET Core 應用程式中。In Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, the and properties are read-write, just as they are in .NET Framework and .NET Core apps. 不過，UWP 應用程式會辨識之單一文化特性。However, UWP apps recognize a single culture. 並中的第一個值的屬性對應[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)集合。The and properties map to the first value in the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) collection. 在.NET Framework 和.NET Core 應用程式中目前的文化特性是每個執行緒設定，而和屬性會反映的文化特性和 UI 文化特性只有目前的執行緒。In .NET Framework and .NET Core apps, the current culture is a per-thread setting, and the and properties reflect the culture and UI culture of the current thread only. 在 UWP 應用程式，目前的文化特性會對應至[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)集合，而這是全域設定。In UWP apps, the current culture maps to the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) collection, which is a global setting. 設定或屬性也會變更整個應用程式的文化特性; 無法設定每個執行緒為基礎的文化特性。Setting the or property changes the culture of the entire app; culture cannot be set on a per-thread basis. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何建立西班牙文 （西班牙） 與國際排序，而另一個物件傳統排序物件。The following example shows how to create a object for Spanish (Spain) with the international sort and another object with the traditional sort. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES/CPP/spanishspain.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES/CS/spanishspain.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES/VB/spanishspain.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 預先定義的文化特性識別項所述[國家語言支援 (NLS) API 參考](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在 Go Global Developer Center。Predefined culture identifiers are listed in the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 在大部分情況下，`culture`參數對應到相對應的國家語言支援 (NLS) 地區設定識別碼。In most cases, the `culture` parameter is mapped to the corresponding National Language Support (NLS) locale identifier. 值`culture`參數的值就會變成屬性的新。The value of the `culture` parameter becomes the value of the property of the new . 我們建議您呼叫的地區設定名稱建構函式，因為地區設定名稱是最好的 Lcid。We recommend that you call the locale name constructor , because locale names are preferable to LCIDs. 自訂地區設定，地區設定名稱是必要的。For custom locales, a locale name is required. 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分透過相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 比方說，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值以外的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 如果指定的文化特性識別項符合目前的 Windows 文化特性的文化特性識別項，這個建構函式會建立使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性和屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If the specified culture identifier matches the culture identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a that uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容(例如，如果所選行事曆不是其中一個) 會定義方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the (for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the ) the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 如果指定的文化特性識別項不符合目前的 Windows 文化特性識別項，這個建構函式會建立，使用指定的文化特性的預設值。If the specified culture identifier does not match the identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a that uses the default values for the specified culture. 屬性永遠設為`true`。The property is always set to `true`. 例如，假設阿拉伯文 （沙烏地阿拉伯） 是目前的 Windows 文化特性，且使用者已為西曆的阿拉伯回曆中變更行事曆。For example, suppose that Arabic (Saudi Arabia) is the current Windows culture and the user has changed the calendar from Hijri to Gregorian. - 具有`CultureInfo("0x0401")`（文化特性名稱 AR-SA），設為（此為使用者設定） 和設定為`true`。With `CultureInfo("0x0401")` (culture name ar-SA), is set to (which is the user setting) and is set to `true`. - 具有`CultureInfo("0x041E")`（文化特性名稱的第個），設為（這是個階的預設月曆） 及設定為`true`。With `CultureInfo("0x041E")` (culture name th-TH), is set to (which is the default calendar for th-TH) and is set to `true`. 對於使用歐元的文化特性，.NET Framework 和 Windows XP 會設定預設貨幣以歐元。For cultures that use the euro, the .NET Framework and Windows XP set the default currency as euro. 不過，舊版 Windows 則否。However, older versions of Windows do not. 因此，如果較舊版本的 Windows 使用者未變更 [貨幣] 設定，透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分，貨幣可能不正確。Therefore, if the user of an older version of Windows has not changed the currency setting through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel, the currency might be incorrect. 若要使用之貨幣的.NET Framework 的預設設定，應用程式應該使用建構函式多載，接受`useUserOverride`參數並將它設定為`false`。To use the .NET Framework default setting for the currency, the application should use a constructor overload that accepts a `useUserOverride` parameter and set it to `false`. > [!NOTE] > 針對回溯相容性、 使用建構的文化特性`culture`必須是 0x0004 或 0x7c04 參數ZH-CHS 或 ZH-CHT，屬性分別。For backwards compatibility, a culture constructed using a `culture` parameter of 0x0004 or 0x7c04 will have a property of zh-CHS or zh-CHT, respectively. 您應該改為想要建構使用-Zh-hans 或 Zh-hant，目前的標準文化特性名稱的文化特性，除非您有使用較舊名稱的原因。You should instead prefer to construct the culture using the current standard culture names of zh-Hans or zh-Hant, unless you have a reason for using the older names.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如需預先定義的文化特性名稱的清單，請參閱 < [ 國家語言支援 (NLS) API 參考](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在 Go Global Developer Center。For a list of predefined culture names, see the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 此外，從 Windows 10，開始`name`可以是任何有效的 BCP-47 語言標記。In addition, starting with Windows 10, `name` can be any valid BCP-47 language tag. 如果`name`已，建構函式會建立執行個體的文化特性而異; 這相當於擷取的值屬性。If `name` is , the constructor creates an instance of the invariant culture; this is equivalent to retrieving the value of the property. 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分透過相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 比方說，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值以外的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 如果文化特性識別項相關聯`name`文化特性識別項，目前的 Windows 文化特性，這個建構函式建立的相符項目物件，使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性和屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If the culture identifier associated with `name` matches the culture identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a object that uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果所選行事曆不是其中一個，不會定義方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 如果文化特性識別項相關聯`name`不的符合目前的 Windows 文化特性，這個建構函式的文化特性識別項建立使用指定的文化特性的預設值的物件。If the culture identifier associated with `name` does not match the culture identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a object that uses the default values for the specified culture. 屬性永遠設為`true`。The property is always set to `true`. 例如，假設阿拉伯文 （沙烏地阿拉伯） 是目前的文化特性的 Windows，而且使用者從回曆曆法變更為西曆。For example, suppose that Arabic (Saudi Arabia) is the current culture of Windows and the user changed the calendar from Hijri to Gregorian. - 具有`CultureInfo("ar-SA")`，設為（此為使用者設定） 和設定為`true`。With `CultureInfo("ar-SA")`, is set to (which is the user setting) and is set to `true`. - 具有`CultureInfo("th-TH")`，設為（這是個階的預設月曆） 及設定為`true`。With `CultureInfo("th-TH")`, is set to (which is the default calendar for th-TH) and is set to `true`. 屬性的新設為具有指定名稱相關聯的文化特性識別項。The property of the new is set to the culture identifier associated with the specified name. 對於使用歐元的文化特性，.NET Framework 和 Windows XP 會設定預設貨幣以歐元。For cultures that use the euro, the .NET Framework and Windows XP set the default currency as euro. 不過，舊版的 Windows 不要這樣。However, older versions of Windows do not do this. 因此，如果較舊版本的 Windows 使用者未變更 [貨幣] 設定，透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分，貨幣可能不正確。Therefore, if the user of an older version of Windows has not changed the currency setting through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel, the currency might be incorrect. 若要使用之貨幣的.NET Framework 的預設設定，應用程式應該使用建構函式多載，接受`useUserOverride`參數並將它設定為`false`。To use the .NET Framework default setting for the currency, the application should use a constructor overload that accepts a `useUserOverride` parameter and set it to `false`. ## Examples 下列範例會擷取目前文化特性。The following example retrieves the current culture. 如果是法文 （法國） 文化特性以外的任何項目，它會呼叫建構函式來具現化代表法文 （法國） 文化特性，並使其成為目前執行緒文化特性的物件。If it is anything other than the French (France) culture, it calls the constructor to instantiate a object that represents the French (France) culture and makes it the current thread culture. 否則，它會具現化代表法文 （盧森堡） 文化特性，並使其成為目前的文化特性的物件。Otherwise, it instantiates a object that represents the French (Luxembourg) culture and makes it the current culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 預先定義的文化特性識別項所述[國家語言支援 (NLS) API 參考](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在 Go Global Developer Center。Predefined culture identifiers are listed in the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 在大部分情況下，`culture`參數對應到相對應的國家語言支援 (NLS) 地區設定識別碼。In most cases, the `culture` parameter is mapped to the corresponding National Language Support (NLS) locale identifier. 值`culture`參數的值就會變成屬性的新。The value of the `culture` parameter becomes the value of the property of the new . 我們建議您呼叫的地區設定名稱建構函式，因為地區設定名稱是最好的 Lcid。We recommend that you call the locale name constructor , because locale names are preferable to LCIDs. 自訂地區設定，地區設定名稱是必要的。For custom locales, a locale name is required. 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分透過相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 比方說，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值以外的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 應用程式應該通常不允許使用者覆寫。Applications should typically not disallow user overrides. 請注意，不允許覆寫也不保證資料穩定性;請參閱部落格文章[文化特性的資料不應該被視為穩定 （但非變異）](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=156850)。Note that disallowing overrides does not itself guarantee data stability; see the blog entry [Culture data shouldn't be considered stable (except for Invariant)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=156850). 如果屬性設定為`true`指定的文化特性識別項符合目前的 Windows 文化特性識別項，這個建構函式會建立使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定的屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性和屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If the property is set to `true` and the specified culture identifier matches the identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a that uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果所選行事曆不是其中一個，不會定義方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 否則，這個建構函式會建立，使用指定的文化特性的預設值。Otherwise, this constructor creates a that uses the default values for the specified culture. 值`useUserOverride`參數的值就會變成屬性。The value of the `useUserOverride` parameter becomes the value of the property. 例如，假設阿拉伯文 （沙烏地阿拉伯） 是目前的文化特性的 Windows，而且使用者已變更從回曆行事曆為西曆。For example, suppose that Arabic (Saudi Arabia) is the current culture of Windows and the user has changed the calendar from Hijri to Gregorian. - 具有`CultureInfo("0x0401", true)`（文化特性名稱 AR-SA），設為（此為使用者設定） 和設定為`true`。With `CultureInfo("0x0401", true)` (culture name ar-SA), is set to (which is the user setting) and is set to `true`. - 具有`CultureInfo("0x0401", false)`（文化特性名稱 AR-SA），設為（此為預設的行事曆 ar sa） 和設定為`false`。With `CultureInfo("0x0401", false)` (culture name ar-SA), is set to (which is the default calendar for ar-SA) and is set to `false`. - 具有`CultureInfo("0x041E", true)`（文化特性名稱的第個），設為（這是個階的預設月曆） 及設定為`true`。With `CultureInfo("0x041E", true)` (culture name th-TH), is set to (which is the default calendar for th-TH) and is set to `true`. - 具有`CultureInfo("0x041E", false)`（文化特性名稱的第個），設為（這是個階的預設月曆） 及設定為`false`。With `CultureInfo("0x041E", false)` (culture name th-TH), is set to (which is the default calendar for th-TH) and is set to `false`. 對於使用歐元的文化特性，.NET Framework 和 Windows XP 會設定預設貨幣以歐元。For cultures that use the euro, the .NET Framework and Windows XP set the default currency as euro. 不過，舊版 Windows 則否。However, older versions of Windows do not. 因此，如果較舊版本的 Windows 使用者未變更 [貨幣] 設定，透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分，貨幣可能不正確。Therefore, if the user of an older version of Windows has not changed the currency setting through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel, the currency might be incorrect. 若要使用之貨幣的.NET Framework 的預設設定，應用程式應該設定`useUserOverride`參數來`false`。To use the .NET Framework default setting for the currency, the application should set the `useUserOverride` parameter to `false`. > [!NOTE] > 針對回溯相容性、 使用建構的文化特性`culture`必須是 0x0004 或 0x7c04 參數ZH-CHS 或 ZH-CHT，屬性分別。For backwards compatibility, a culture constructed using a `culture` parameter of 0x0004 or 0x7c04 will have a property of zh-CHS or zh-CHT, respectively. 您應該改為想要建構使用-Zh-hans 或 Zh-hant，目前的標準文化特性名稱的文化特性，除非您有使用較舊名稱的原因。You should instead prefer to construct the culture using the current standard culture names of zh-Hans or zh-Hant, unless you have a reason for using the older names.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分透過相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 比方說，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值以外的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 如果已`true`和指定的文化特性相符的 Windows，目前的文化特性會使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性，和資料庫屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If is `true` and the specified culture matches the current culture of Windows, the uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果所選行事曆不是其中一個，不會定義方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 因此，如果是`true`，這個屬性的值可能與不同文化特性所使用的預設曆法。Therefore, if is `true`, the value of this property might be different from the default calendar used by the culture. 您的應用程式會變更目前所使用的行事曆藉由設定屬性，這是執行個體類別。Your application changes the calendar used by the current by setting the property of , which is an instance of the class. 新的行事曆必須是其中一項中所列的行事曆。The new calendar must be one of the calendars listed in . 也包含 自訂日期和時間格式的相關聯的其他屬性。 also includes other properties that customize the date and time formatting associated with that .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 資訊，例如預設文化特性和格式模式中，會快取要求的第一次。Information, such as the default culture and format patterns, is cached the first time it is requested. 存留期間，可以變更資訊，比方說，當使用者修改 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分。That information can change during the life of the , for example, when the user modifies the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 不過，類別不會自動偵測變更系統設定 中。However, the class does not automatically detect changes in the system settings. 方法會清除的快取所建立的物件，並重新整理中的資訊， ，和根據目前的系統設定的屬性。The method clears the cache of objects created by and refreshes the information in the , , and properties, based on the current system settings. 方法不會重新整理中的資訊現有的執行緒屬性。The method does not refresh the information in the property for existing threads. 不過，未來的執行緒會有任何新屬性值。However, future threads will have any new property values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 複製為可寫入即使原始處於唯讀狀態。The clone is writable even if the original is read-only. 因此，您可修改複製品的屬性。Therefore, the properties of the clone can be modified. 物件的淺層複本是物件的一份只有。A shallow copy of an object is a copy of the object only. 如果物件包含其他物件的參考，則淺層複製不會建立參考物件的複本。If the object contains references to other objects, the shallow copy does not create copies of the referred objects. 它改為參考原始物件。It refers to the original objects instead. 相較之下，物件的深層複本建立一份物件和一份直接或間接參考該物件的所有項目。In contrast, a deep copy of an object creates a copy of the object and a copy of everything directly or indirectly referenced by that object. 方法會建立增強的淺層複本。The method creates an enhanced shallow copy. 所傳回的物件， ， ，和屬性也會被複製。The objects returned by the , , , and properties are also copied. 因此，複製物件可以修改其複製的內容，而不會影響原始物件。Consequently, the cloned object can modify its copied properties without affecting the original object. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範 CultureInfo.Clone 也複製並相關聯的執行個體。The following code example shows that CultureInfo.Clone also clones the and instances associated with the . remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會傳回提供區分文化特性的排序和字串比較作業中使用的特定文化特性資訊的物件。The property returns a object that provides culture-specific information used in culture-sensitive sorting and string comparison operations. 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分透過相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 比方說，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值以外的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 如果已`true`和指定的文化特性相符的 Windows，目前的文化特性會使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性，和資料庫屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If is `true` and the specified culture matches the current culture of Windows, the uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果所選行事曆不是其中一個，不會定義方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何建立西班牙文 （西班牙） 與國際排序，而另一個與傳統的排序。The following code example shows how to create a for Spanish (Spain) with the international sort and another with the traditional sort. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會包裝對建構函式。The method wraps a call to the constructor. > [!NOTE] > 如需預先定義的文化特性名稱的清單，請參閱 < [ 國家語言支援 (NLS) API 參考](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在 Go Global Developer Center。For a list of predefined culture names, see the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 此外，從 Windows 10，開始`name`可以是任何有效的 BCP-47 語言標記。In addition, starting with Windows 10, `name` can be any valid BCP-47 language tag. 文化特性會分組為三個集合： 文化特性而異，中性文化特性和特定文化特性。Cultures are grouped into three sets: the invariant culture, the neutral cultures, and the specific cultures. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱說明類別。For more information, see the description of the class. 如果這個方法所傳回的特定文化特性的文化特性識別項符合目前的 Windows 文化特性的文化特性識別項，這個方法會建立會使用 Windows 的文化特性的物件會覆寫。If the culture identifier of the specific culture returned by this method matches the culture identifier of the current Windows culture, this method creates a object that uses the Windows culture overrides. 覆寫包含使用者設定的屬性所傳回的物件屬性並所傳回的物件屬性。The overrides include user settings for the properties of the object returned by the property and the object returned by the property. 若要具現化物件，使用預設文化特性設定而不是使用者覆寫時，呼叫建構函式值是`false`的`useUserOverride`引數。To instantiate a object that with default culture settings rather than user overrides, call the constructor with a value of `false` for the `useUserOverride` argument. 雖然方法名稱包含 「 特定 」 一詞，請記住，文化特性的資料可以變更之間的版本中，或因為自訂文化特性，或因為使用者覆寫。Although the method name includes the term "Specific", remember that culture data can change between versions, or due to custom cultures, or because of user overrides. 使用文化特性而異或二進位或固定的形式來儲存資料。Use the invariant culture or binary or fixed forms for saving data. ## Examples 下列範例會擷取陣列物件以代表中性文化特性，從方法，並排序陣列。The following example retrieves an array of objects that represent neutral cultures from the method and sorts the array. 當它逐一查看陣列中的項目時，會傳遞至每個中性文化特性名稱方法並顯示由方法傳回的特定文化特性的名稱。When it iterates the elements in the array, it passes the name of each neutral culture to the method and displays the name of the specific culture returned by the method. > [!NOTE] > 此範例會使用 ZH-CHS 和 ZH-CHT 文化特性名稱。The example uses the zh-CHS and zh-CHT culture names. 不過，目標 Windows Vista 和更新版本應使用而不是 ZH-CHS 和 Zh-hant 而不是 ZH-CHT-Zh-hans 的應用程式。However, applications that target Windows Vista and later should use zh-Hans instead of zh-CHS and zh-Hant instead of zh-CHT. -Zh-hans 與 Zh-hant 代表目前的標準，應該使用，除非您有使用較舊名稱的原因。zh-Hans and zh-Hant represent the current standard and should be used unless you have a reason for using the older names. > > 也請注意，範例的結果可能不同的是中文 （繁體） 中性文化特性 （zh、 ZH-CHT 或 Zh-hant） 輸入傳回 ZH-TW 的所在的台灣 Windows 安裝上。Note also that the results of the example may differ on an installation of Taiwanese Windows, where the input of a Chinese (Traditional) neutral culture (zh, zh-CHT, or zh-Hant) will return zh-TW. summary.span: 取得或設定 物件，這個物件代表目前執行緒使用的文化特性。

span.span: Gets or sets the object that represents the culture used by the current thread.

value.span: 物件，代表目前執行緒使用的文化特性。

span.span: An object that represents the culture used by the current thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個屬性會傳回的物件和其相關聯的物件判斷預設格式的日期、 時間、 數字、 貨幣值，排序順序的文字、 大小寫慣例，以及字串比較。The object that is returned by this property and its associated objects determine the default format for dates, times, numbers, currency values, the sorting order of text, casing conventions, and string comparisons. 目前的文化特性是執行中執行緒的屬性。The current culture is a property of the executing thread. 擷取的值屬性相當於更多高效能的擷取所傳回的物件`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture`屬性。Retrieving the value of the property is a more performant equivalent of retrieving the object returned by the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture` property. > [!NOTE] > 在.NET Framework 4.5.2 和舊版中，屬性是唯讀的; 也就是說，您可以擷取屬性值，但您無法將它設定。In the .NET Framework 4.5.2 and earlier versions, the property is read-only; that is, you can retrieve the property value, but you cannot set it. 若要變更目前的文化特性，您指派物件，表示新的文化特性`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture`屬性。To change the current culture, you assign the object that represents the new culture to the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture` property. 開頭[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，則屬性是讀寫; 您可設定和擷取屬性的值。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the property is read-write; you can both set and retrieve the property's value. 如果您沒有設定屬性值為物件，表示新的文化特性的值`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture`屬性也會變更。If you do set the property value to a object that represents a new culture, the value of the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture` property also changes. 本節內容：In this section: [如何判斷執行緒的文化特性](#ThreadCulture) [How a Thread's Culture Is Determined](#ThreadCulture) [取得目前的文化特性](#Getting) [Getting the Current Culture](#Getting) [明確設定 CurrentCulture 屬性](#ExplicitSetting) [Explicitly Setting the CurrentCulture Property](#ExplicitSetting) [目前的文化特性和使用者覆寫](#Overrides) [The Current Culture and User Overrides](#Overrides) [文化特性和 Windows 應用程式Culture and Windows Apps](#WindowsAndCurr) ## 如何判斷執行緒的文化特性How a Thread's Culture Is Determined 在執行緒啟動時，其文化特性是一開始決定，如下所示：When a thread is started, its culture is initially determined as follows: - 藉由擷取所指定的文化特性執行緒正在其中執行，如果屬性值不是應用程式定義域中的屬性`null`。By retrieving the culture that is specified by the property in the application domain in which the thread is executing, if the property value is not `null`. - 如果執行緒集區執行緒執行工作為基礎的非同步作業和應用程式目標[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]或更新版本的.NET Framework 中，其文化特性取決於呼叫執行緒的文化特性。If the thread is a thread pool thread that is executing a task-based asynchronous operation and the app targets the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)] or a later version of the .NET Framework, its culture is determined by the culture of the calling thread. 下列範例將目前的文化特性變更為葡萄牙文 （巴西），並啟動六個工作，其中每一個會顯示其執行緒 ID、 其工作識別碼和其目前的文化特性。The following example changes the current culture to Portuguese (Brazil) and launches six tasks, each of which displays its thread ID, its task ID, and its current culture. 每個工作 （執行緒） 有繼承呼叫執行緒的文化特性。Each of the tasks (and the threads) has inherited the culture of the calling thread. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/Async1.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/Async1.vb#14)] 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 「 文化特性和以工作為基礎的非同步作業 > 一節中主題。For more information, see the "Culture and task-based asynchronous operations" section in the topic. - 藉由呼叫 Windows`GetUserDefaultLocaleName`函式。By calling the Windows `GetUserDefaultLocaleName` function. 請注意，是否您設定特定的文化特性不同的系統安裝的文化特性或使用者的慣用文化特性，而且您的應用程式會啟動多個執行緒，這些執行緒的目前文化特性，將會是所傳回的文化特性`GetUserDefaultLocaleName`函式，除非您將指定的文化特性執行緒正在執行的應用程式定義域中的屬性。Note that if you set a specific culture that is different from the system-installed culture or the user's preferred culture, and your application starts multiple threads, the current culture of those threads will be the culture that is returned by the `GetUserDefaultLocaleName` function, unless you assign a culture to the property in the application domain in which the thread is executing. 如需有關如何判斷執行緒的文化特性的詳細資訊，請參閱中的 < 文化特性和執行緒 > 一節參考頁面。For more information about how the culture of a thread is determined, see the "Culture and threads" section in the reference page. ## 取得目前的文化特性Getting the Current Culture 屬性是每個執行緒設定，也就是每個執行緒可以有它自己的文化特性。The property is a per-thread setting; that is, each thread can have its own culture. 您所擷取的值取得目前執行緒的文化特性屬性，如下列範例說明。You get the culture of the current thread by retrieving the value of the property, as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/Get1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/Get1.vb#5)] 您也可以擷取從目前執行緒的文化特性值屬性。You can also retrieve the value of the current thread's culture from the property. ## 明確設定 CurrentCulture 屬性Explicitly Setting the CurrentCulture Property 繼續[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，以變更現有的執行緒，使用的文化特性設定為新的文化特性的屬性。Staring with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], to change the culture that is used by an existing thread, you set the property to the new culture. 如果您明確變更執行緒的文化特性，如此一來，變更會保存如果執行緒跨越應用程式定義域界限。If you explicitly change a thread's culture in this way, that change persists if the thread crosses application domain boundaries. 下列範例會變更目前執行緒文化特性為荷蘭文 （荷蘭）。The following example changes the current thread culture to Dutch (Netherlands). 它也會顯示，當目前的執行緒跨越應用程式定義域界限，其目前的文化特性會保持變更。It also shows that, when the current thread crosses application domain boundaries, its current culture remains changed. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/changeculture11.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/changeculture11.vb#11)] > [!NOTE] > 變更使用的文化特性屬性需要具有權限值的設定。Changing the culture by using the property requires a permission with the value set. 操作執行緒有危險，因為與執行緒相關聯的安全性狀態。Manipulating threads is dangerous because of the security state associated with threads. 因此，只有可靠的程式碼，然後必要時，才應指定此權限。Therefore, this permission should be given only to trustworthy code, and then only as necessary. 您無法變更非完全信任的程式碼中的執行緒文化特性。You cannot change thread culture in semi-trusted code. 從開始[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]，您可以明確地變更目前執行緒文化特性 （例如，法文 （加拿大）） 的特定文化特性或中性文化特性 （例如，法文）。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], you can explicitly change the current thread culture to either a specific culture (such as French (Canada)) or a neutral culture (such as French). 當物件都代表中性文化特性的值屬性，例如， ， ， ，和反映相關聯的特定文化特性中性文化特性。When a object represents a neutral culture, the values of properties such as , , , , and reflect the specific culture that is associated with the neutral culture. 例如，英文的中性文化特性的主要文化特性是英文 （美國）;主控項的文化特性，德文文化特性是德文 （德國）。For example, the dominant culture for the English neutral culture is English (United States); the dominant culture for the German culture is German (Germany). 下列範例說明格式化當目前的文化特性設定為特定文化特性、 法文 （加拿大） 和中性文化特性，差異法文。The following example illustrates the difference in formatting when the current culture is set to a specific culture, French (Canada), and a neutral culture, French. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/specific12.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/specific12.vb#12)] 您也可以使用屬性連同屬性來設定屬性的 ASP.NET 應用程式給使用者的慣用文化特性，如下列範例所示。You can also use the property along with the property to set the property of an ASP.NET application to the user's preferred culture, as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/aspculture13.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/aspculture13.vb#13)] ## 目前的文化特性和使用者覆寫The Current Culture and User Overrides Windows 可讓使用者覆寫的標準屬性值物件和其相關聯的物件，使用**地區及語言選項**控制項台中。Windows allows users to override the standard property values of the object and its associated objects by using **Regional and Language Options** in Control Panel. 所傳回的物件屬性會反映這些使用者覆寫在下列情況：The object returned by the property reflects these user overrides in the following cases: - 如果由 Windows 隱含設定目前執行緒文化特性`GetUserDefaultLocaleName`函式。If the current thread culture is set implicitly by the Windows `GetUserDefaultLocaleName` function. - 如果目前執行緒文化特性所定義屬性會對應至目前的 Windows 系統文化特性。If the current thread culture defined by the property corresponds to the current Windows system culture. - 如果目前執行緒文化特性設定明確地為所傳回的文化特性方法和文化特性與目前的 Windows 系統文化特性。If the current thread culture is set explicitly to a culture returned by the method, and that culture corresponds to the current Windows system culture. - 如果目前執行緒文化特性設明確具現化的文化特性建構函式，和文化特性與目前的 Windows 系統文化特性。If the current thread culture is set explicitly to a culture instantiated by the constructor, and that culture corresponds to the current Windows system culture. 在某些情況下，特別是針對伺服器應用程式，將目前的文化特性設定為可能不會反映使用者覆寫的物件。In some cases, particularly for server applications, setting the current culture to a object that reflects user overrides may be undesirable. 相反地，您可以將目前執行緒文化特性設定為不會反映使用者的物件會覆寫，以下列方式：Instead, you can set the current thread culture to a object that does not reflect user overrides in the following ways: - 藉由呼叫建構函式的值`false`如`useUserOverride`引數。By calling the constructor with a value of `false` for the `useUserOverride` argument. - 藉由呼叫方法，以傳回快取，唯讀物件。By calling the method, which returns a cached, read-only object. ## 目前的文化特性和 UWP 應用程式The current culture and UWP apps 在通用 Windows 平台 (UWP) 應用程式，屬性是讀寫，就如同它是.NET Framework 和.NET Core 應用程式中，您可以使用它來取得和設定目前的文化特性。In Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, the property is read-write, just as it is in .NET Framework and .NET Core apps; you can use it both to get and to set the current culture. 不過，UWP 應用程式無法區分目前的文化特性與目前的 UI 文化特性。However, UWP apps do not distinguish between the current culture and the current UI culture. 並中的第一個值的屬性對應[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)集合。The and properties map to the first value in the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) collection. 在.NET Framework 和.NET Core 應用程式中目前的文化特性是每個執行緒設定，而屬性會反映目前執行緒的文化特性。In .NET Framework and .NET Core apps, the current culture is a per-thread setting, and the property reflects the culture of the current thread only. 在 UWP 應用程式，目前的文化特性會對應至[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)屬性，這是一種全域設定。In UWP apps, the current culture maps to the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) property, which is a global setting. 設定屬性也會變更整個應用程式的文化特性; 無法設定每個執行緒為基礎的文化特性。Setting the property changes the culture of the entire app; culture cannot be set on a per-thread basis. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何變更和目前執行緒。The following example demonstrates how to change the and of the current thread. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/CPP/currentculture.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/CS/currentculture.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/VB/currentculture.vb#11)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 目前的 UI 文化特性是每個執行緒屬性。The current UI culture is a per-thread property. 也就是每個執行緒都有它自己的目前 UI 文化特性。That is, each thread has its own current UI culture. 這個屬性就相當於擷取，或開頭[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，將物件指派給`System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture`屬性。This property is equivalent to retrieving or, starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], setting the object assigned to the `System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture` property. 在執行緒啟動時，其 UI 文化特性是一開始決定，如下所示：When a thread is started, its UI culture is initially determined as follows: - 藉由擷取所指定的文化特性執行緒正在其中執行，如果屬性值不是應用程式定義域中的屬性`null`。By retrieving the culture that is specified by the property in the application domain in which the thread is executing, if the property value is not `null`. - 如果執行緒集區執行緒執行工作為基礎的非同步作業和應用程式目標[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]或更新版本的.NET Framework 中，其 UI 文化特性取決於呼叫執行緒 UI 文化特性。If the thread is a thread pool thread that is executing a task-based asynchronous operation and the app targets the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)] or a later version of the .NET Framework, its UI culture is determined by the UI culture of the calling thread. 下列範例會變成葡萄牙文 （巴西） 中的目前 UI 文化特性，並啟動六個工作，其中每一個會顯示其執行緒 ID、 其工作識別碼和其目前的 UI 文化特性。The following example changes the current UI culture to Portuguese (Brazil) and launches six tasks, each of which displays its thread ID, its task ID, and its current UI culture. 每個工作 （執行緒） 有繼承呼叫執行緒 UI 文化特性。Each of the tasks (and the threads) has inherited the UI culture of the calling thread. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/cs/Async1.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/vb/Async1.vb#14)] 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 「 文化特性和以工作為基礎的非同步作業 > 一節中主題。For more information, see the "Culture and task-based asynchronous operations" section in the topic. - 藉由呼叫 Windows`GetUserDefaultUILanguage`函式。By calling the Windows `GetUserDefaultUILanguage` function. > [!NOTE] > 在 [!INCLUDE[Compact](~/includes/compact-md.md)]，則屬性是唯讀的。In the [!INCLUDE[Compact](~/includes/compact-md.md)], the property is read-only. 目前的 UI 文化特性會取決於系統的地區設定，而且不能以程式設計方式變更。The current UI culture is determined by the system's regional settings and cannot be changed programmatically. 開頭[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，若要變更的使用者介面文化特性使用的執行緒，設定為新的文化特性的屬性。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], to change the user interface culture used by a thread, set the property to the new culture. 如果您明確變更執行緒的 UI 文化特性，如此一來，變更會保存如果執行緒跨越應用程式定義域界限。If you explicitly change a thread's UI culture in this way, that change persists if the thread crosses application domain boundaries. > [!NOTE] > 在.NET Framework 4.5.2 和舊版中，屬性是唯讀的; 也就是說，您可以擷取屬性值，但您無法將它設定。In the .NET Framework 4.5.2 and earlier versions, the property is read-only; that is, you can retrieve the property value, but you cannot set it. 若要變更目前的 UI 文化特性，您指派物件，表示新的 UI 文化特性，以`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture`屬性。To change the current UI culture, you assign the object that represents the new UI culture to the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture` property. 開頭[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，則屬性是讀寫; 您可設定和擷取屬性的值。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the property is read-write; you can both set and retrieve the property's value. 如果您沒有設定屬性值為物件，表示新的文化特性的值`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture`屬性也會變更。If you do set the property value to a object that represents a new culture, the value of the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture` property also changes. 本節內容：In this section: [取得目前的 UI 文化特性](#Getting) [Getting the Current UI Culture](#Getting) [明確地設定目前 UI 文化特性](#Explicit) [Explicitly Setting the Current UI Culture](#Explicit) [隱含地設定目前 UI 文化特性](#Implicit) [Implicitly Setting the Current UI Culture](#Implicit) [安全性考量](#Security) [Security Considerations](#Security) [目前的 UI 文化特性和 Windows 應用程式The Current UI Culture and Windows apps](#WindowsAndCurrUI) ## 取得目前的 UI 文化特性Getting the Current UI Culture 屬性是每個執行緒設定，也就是每個執行緒可以有它自己的 UI 文化特性。The property is a per-thread setting; that is, each thread can have its own UI culture. 您所擷取的值取得目前的執行緒 UI 文化特性屬性，如下列範例說明。You get the UI culture of the current thread by retrieving the value of the property, as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/cs/Get1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/vb/Get1.vb#5)] 您也可以擷取從目前的執行緒 UI 文化特性值屬性。You can also retrieve the value of the current thread's UI culture from the property. ## 明確地設定目前 UI 文化特性Explicitly Setting the Current UI Culture 開頭[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，您可以藉由指派變更的目前 UI 文化特性物件，表示新的文化特性屬性。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], you can change the current UI culture by assigning a object that represents the new culture to the property. 可以設定目前 UI 文化特性，可能是特定文化特性 （例如 EN-US 或 DE-DE） 或中性文化特性 （例如 en-us 或 de）。The current UI culture can be set to either a specific culture (such as en-US or de-DE) or to a neutral culture (such as en or de). 下列範例會設定目前 UI 文化特性為 FR-FR 或法文 （法國）。The following example sets the current UI culture to fr-FR or French (France). [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/cs/currentuiculture1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/vb/currentuiculture1.vb#1)] 在多執行緒應用程式中，您可以明確地設定 UI 文化特性的任何執行緒指派物件，表示執行緒的文化特性的屬性。In a multithreaded application, you can explicitly set the UI culture of any thread by assigning a object that represents that culture to the thread's property. 如果您想要設定的文化特性是目前的執行緒，您可以指派至新的文化特性屬性。If the thread whose culture you want to set is the current thread, you can assign the new culture to the property. 當執行緒 UI 文化特性已明確設定，即使跨越應用程式定義域界限，並在另一個應用程式定義域中執行的程式碼的執行緒會保留相同的文化特性。When the UI culture of a thread is set explicitly, that thread retains the same culture even if it crosses application domain boundaries and executes code in another application domain. ## 隱含地設定目前 UI 文化特性Implicitly Setting the Current UI Culture 當執行緒，包括主應用程式執行緒，第一次，依預設會建立其目前的 UI 文化特性設定，如下所示：When a thread, including the main application thread, is first created, by default its current UI culture is set as follows: - 使用所定義的文化特性目前的應用程式定義域如果屬性值不是屬性`null`。By using the culture defined by the property for the current application domain if the property value is not `null`. - 使用系統的預設文化特性。By using the system's default culture. 在使用 Windows 作業系統的系統中，通用語言執行平台會呼叫 Windows`GetUserDefaultUILanguage`函式來設定目前 UI 文化特性。On systems that use the Windows operating system, the common language runtime calls the Windows `GetUserDefaultUILanguage` function to set the current UI culture. `GetUserDefaultUILanguage` 傳回使用者所設定的預設 UI 文化特性。`GetUserDefaultUILanguage` returns the default UI culture set by the user. 如果使用者未設定預設 UI 語言，它會傳回原先安裝在系統上的文化特性。If the user has not set a default UI language, it returns the culture originally installed on the system. 如果執行緒跨越應用程式界限，並在另一個應用程式定義域中執行的程式碼，其文化特性會判斷為新建立執行緒的相同的方式。If the thread crosses application boundaries and executes code in another application domain, its culture is determined in the same way as that of a newly created thread. 請注意，如果您設定特定的 UI 文化特性的系統安裝的 UI 文化特性不同或使用者偏好的 UI 文化特性，且您的應用程式會啟動多個執行緒，這些執行緒的目前 UI 文化特性的文化特性，傳回`GetUserDefaultUILanguage`函式，除非您將指定的文化特性執行緒正在執行的應用程式定義域中的屬性。Note that if you set a specific UI culture that is different from the system-installed UI culture or the user's preferred UI culture, and your application starts multiple threads, the current UI culture of those threads will be the culture returned by the `GetUserDefaultUILanguage` function, unless you assign a culture to the property in the application domain in which the thread is executing. ## 安全性考量Security Considerations 變更目前執行緒文化特性，您必須具有權限值的設定。Changing the culture of the current thread requires a permission with the value set. > [!CAUTION] > 操作執行緒有危險，因為與執行緒相關聯的安全性狀態。Manipulating threads is dangerous because of the security state associated with threads. 因此，只有可靠的程式碼，然後必要時，才應指定此權限。Therefore, this permission should be given only to trustworthy code, and then only as necessary. 您無法變更非完全信任的程式碼中的執行緒文化特性。You cannot change thread culture in semi-trusted code. ## 目前 UI 文化特性和 UWP 應用程式The current UI culture and UWP apps 在通用 Windows 平台 (UWP) 應用程式，屬性是讀寫，就如同它是.NET Framework 和.NET Core 應用程式中，您可以使用它來取得和設定目前的文化特性。In Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, the property is read-write, just as it is in .NET Framework and .NET Core apps; you can use it both to get and to set the current culture. 不過，UWP 應用程式無法區分目前的文化特性與目前的 UI 文化特性。However, UWP apps do not distinguish between the current culture and the current UI culture. 並中的第一個值的屬性對應[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)集合。The and properties map to the first value in the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) collection. 在.NET Framework 和.NET Core 應用程式中的目前 UI 文化特性是每個執行緒設定，而屬性會反映目前執行緒的 UI 文化特性。In .NET Framework and .NET Core apps, the current UI culture is a per-thread setting, and the property reflects the UI culture of the current thread only. 在 UWP 應用程式，目前的文化特性會對應至[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)屬性，這是一種全域設定。In UWP apps, the current culture maps to the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) property, which is a global setting. 設定屬性也會變更整個應用程式的文化特性; 無法設定每個執行緒為基礎的文化特性。Setting the property changes the culture of the entire app; culture cannot be set on a per-thread basis. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何變更和目前執行緒。The following code example demonstrates how to change the and of the current thread. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/CPP/currentculture.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/CS/currentculture.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/VB/currentculture.vb#11)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## OverridesOverrides 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分透過相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 比方說，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值以外的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 如果已`true`和指定的文化特性相符的 Windows，目前的文化特性會使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性，和資料庫屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If is `true` and the specified culture matches the current culture of Windows, the uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果所選行事曆不是其中一個，不會定義方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 值屬性和屬性則不會計算直到您的應用程式存取的屬性。The value of the property and the property is not calculated until your application accesses the property. 使用者時執行的應用程式，然後再應用程式的存取，如果可以變更目前的文化特性為新的文化特性或屬性，應用程式會擷取新的文化特性，而不是覆寫的預設值原始的文化特性。If the user can change the current culture to a new culture while the application is running and then the application accesses the or property, the application retrieves the defaults for the new culture instead of the overrides for the original culture. 若要保留原始的目前文化特性的覆寫，應該存取的應用程式和之前變更目前的文化特性的屬性。To preserve the overrides for the original current culture, the application should access the and properties before changing the current culture. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範 CultureInfo.Clone 也複製並相關聯的執行個體。The following code example shows that CultureInfo.Clone also clones the and instances associated with the .
